cluster_relations.rel_desc: The caterpillar attaches its body to a leaf as part of forming the chrysalis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject organism physically secures or anchors itself to the surface of the object, typically as a substrate for a life-stage transition or resting.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis

qualifiers.CausalHint: as it prepares for the next stage

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The caterpillar may attach itself to a stem as an alternative to a leaf when forming the chrysalis.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject organism physically secures or anchors itself to the surface of the object, typically as a substrate for a life-stage transition or resting.
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Biological Structures and Substances in Butterfly Metamorphosis

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject organism or object physically secures or anchors itself to the surface or structure of the object, using it as a substrate or support.
args.justification: The existing canonical_rel_desc is overly specific to life-stage transitions (chrysalis formation), while the predicate 'attaches_to' and the class 'substrate_attachment_relation' are more generally applicable to any physical attachment to a substrate or support. Updating only the description to a stage-agnostic formulation improves reusability of the predicate across contexts without altering its intended semantics for these instances.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Subject organism or object physically secures or anchors itself to the surface or structure of the object, using it as a substrate or support.
executed_decisions.justification: The existing canonical_rel_desc is overly specific to life-stage transitions (chrysalis formation), while the predicate 'attaches_to' and the class 'substrate_attachment_relation' are more generally applicable to any physical attachment to a substrate or support. Updating only the description to a stage-agnostic formulation improves reusability of the predicate across contexts without altering its intended semantics for these instances.
